resources.string: Allows modification of PDroid settings associated with applications.
Allows reading of PDroid settings associated with applications.
Allows configuration of which apps are able to change PDroid settings
Open the thread on xda-developers.com in your browser
Use the device locale to determine the interface language
Create a backup of current settings
No backups are available to restore

The digital signature for the selected backup file does not match the backup. The backup may have been modified by another program. Uninstalling and re-installed PDroid Manager since you created the backup will also cause this message.
No digital signature can be found for the selected backup file. There is no way to verify that the backup file has not been modified by another program since it was created.
Continue to restore settings from the file?
The selected file is missing, corrupted, or not a valid backup file.
Restore failed: The selected file is not a valid backup file.
Restore failed: The selected file could not be read.
Restore failed: An error prevented restoration.
Please wait while your backup is restored
The external storage cannot be accessed. If you device uses an external SD Card or Micro SD Card please ensure it is inserted and properly formatted.
Your backup will be stored in:
A file with the speficied filename already exists. The new backup will replace the existing file.
Continue to backup to the file?
Backup failed: Signing of the backup failed
Backup failed: The backup file could not be written
Backup failed: The backup file could not be generated

PDroid Manager

Development: Simeon Morgan <smorgan@digitalfeed.net>
Github: wsot
XDA-developers: FFU5y

With contributions from:

patrickpr (github): French translation
TamCore (github | xda): Makefile creation, German translation
wbedard (xda): Original English descriptions for the settings
PDroid Manager thread at xda-developers.com

PDroid Manager relies on the fine work done on the PDroid core by others

PDroid 2.0 Core

Development: CollegeDev (xda)
PDroid 2.0 thread at xda-developers.com

PDroid porting to ICS/JB

Pastime (xda)
PDroid ICS/JB thread at xda-developers.com

PDroid

Development: Syvat (xda)
PDroid thread at xda-developers.com

Please note:

This app is not endorsed by Syvat, Pastime, or CollegeDev. Please do not seek help for the PDroid Manager application on their threads.

PDroid Manager is a setting management application for the Privacy service provided by the PDroid 2.0 Core. It serves as an open-source alternative for the PDroid 2.0 App by CollegeDev.

PDroid Manager is currently in alpha

If you find a problem:

First, check if the problem you have discovered is a known issue, by looking at issues on my github. If if has already been lodged, but you have additional information to add, then ideally attach it to the issue in github. Otherwise, you can post it here but please clearly refer to the existing issue in github when doing so.

If it is not a known issue in the github:

You can open an issue on my github, providing a logcat: see how to get a logcat. You can post on the XDA thread, providing a logcat.
